Clip.Title: RUTKA - A DIARY OF A HOLOCAUST
Clip.Episode: Rutka - A Diary of The Holocaust
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Israeli woman discovers she had a half sister killed in the Holocaust. Upon finding her diary, she retraces her steps from her life in the Ghetto to her tragic end at Auschwitz.

Clip.Title: U455 - THE MYSTERY OF THE LOST SUBMARINE
Clip.Episode: U455 - The Mystery of the Lost Submarine
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In summer 2008, a mysterious submarine was discovered off the coast of Italy at 120 meters deep. For Lorenzo del Veneziano, an underwater marine archeologist, it was an amazing sight, as the submarine was intact! Could this be the wreck of the long lost U-455, the last missing German U-boat from World War II?

Clip.Title: SERIOUSLY AMAZING OBJECTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Lindbergh's Spirit of St. Louis, Irving Berlin's piano, and Seinfeld's puffy shirt. These are just some of the many items flown, touched, played, and worn by American icons, whose great success stories can be found at the Smithsonian. Join us as we give lucky museum goers a chance to get close to some Seriously Amazing Objects. Many of these treasures are locked deep in the vaults and are not always on public display...until now.

Clip.Title: RUTKA - A DIARY OF A HOLOCAUST

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: World's Most Powerful Microscope, Super Laser and the Northern Lights
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Nanosciene has a miraculous new microscope, the most powerful in the world. And, scientists are planning to use the largest laser beam in the world to shoot tremendous bursts of energy to recreate fusion. And Alaska's Northern Lights are one of the world's greatest natural mysteries.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Autism: Searching for Causes, Home Genetic Testing and Forensic Anthropology
Clip.EpisodeSummary: To learn more about autismn, scientists are looking not only at genes, but also a host of lifestyle and environmental factors. And, what if you could learn your odds of getting a disease? Home genetic testing kits allows anybody to do so. And, meet a forensic anthropologist who's developed a novel technique to help identify the remains of migrants who die crossing the U.S.-Mexico border.

Clip.Title: THE BRAIN THAT CHANGES ITSELF
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on the best-selling book by Toronto psychiatrist and researcher Dr. Norman Doidge, a look at how we view the human mind.

Clip.Title: CHANGING YOUR MIND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Leading-edge research into the problems of the complex human mind, a follow-up documentary to "The Brain that Changes Itself".

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Pastor Bill Versteeg works with the Lifewater team in Liberia to drill wells to ease the water crisis.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Emmanuelle boards the "Train of Life", a small railway of 163 kilometers from the high lands to the Indian Ocean. Only one train, only one engine and only one set of tracks.

Clip.Title: CORSICA: THE PEARL OF THE MEDITERRANEAN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This series takes us on a journey to discover the island's history, its culture and its proud people.

Clip.Title: BECOMING A MAN...
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Among the Borana. Follow a young boy in Ethiopia as he learns his ancestral tradition of salt trading and a nomadic lifestyle.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
